etymologies: late 16th century: from late Latin praeteritio(n-), from praeterire ‘pass, go by’

definitions: the action of passing over or disregarding a matter, especially the rhetorical technique of mentioning something by professing to omit it

examples.text: the favourite rhetorical trope of the historical novelists is preterition, saying that you are not going to say something and thereby saying it

shortDefinitions: action of passing over or disregarding matter

definitions: (in Calvinist theology) the state of not being predestined to salvation.
shortDefinitions: state of not being predestined to salvation
